website_summaries.verdict: This oil drain pan holds a lot of oil and comes with a wire handle to help you get it to the right place under your car.
pros: Made from a very durable plastic
Wire handle helps you place the pan under your car
Spout makes it easy to remove the oil from the pan
Lipped edges help keep oil from spilling
Holds up to 5 gallons of oil
cons: This pan does not have a top cover to make it portable enough to use easily for taking your oil to a recycling center

customer_reviews.title: This is the drain pan that I have been looking for.....
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever noticed that plastic drain pans have diminished in quality? Years ago they were durable. Today though, it seems you can only find thin, disposable, easily punctured, junk. I want you all to know this is not the case with this pan. This pan is very durable. See the picture below of me standing on the thing. I will also tell you that I weigh 240 lbs.... Tool trucks only seem to sell Lisle and Blitz pans, which are thinner and less durable. Buy this pan with confidence because it will last you a very long time if you take care of it properly
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Hunsberger

customer_reviews.title: Awkward
customer_reviews.text: The wire bail handle is handy for dragging it out from under a vehicle. A molded in handle opposite the spout would massively increase general usability. I've never had a drain pan that I didn't need to pick up and pour out, and this one has no provision for that step. And speaking of that spout... a tethered cap is one of those things that looks great on paper. In the real world, it has to either be removed or held aside or it flops in front of whatever you're pouring out, and makes a splattered mess. Just one more thing that makes pouring unnecessarily awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Steven  Melander

customer_reviews.title: Prevent splatter with lip
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of spill and splatter when draining into my recycled oil container. So bought this, really like the lip to contain everything. Not the biggest deal, but vcd the spout has only a rubber cap and is not threaded, like I said not a big deal as most ppl plastic threads would strip anyways. Just thought to point it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Cameron

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this 5 stars if the spout were angled so that when I emptied it into gallon jugs the jug would not be horizontal. It's great that the spout fits inside a gallon jug, but once you start pouring, very little can be poured into the jug before the contents of the jug start spilling out.
customer_reviews.author: HBreese

customer_reviews.title: The best automotive drain pan I've found!  Plastic construction is very strong and rigid.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pan for draining and flushing anti freeze coolant. Rotating wire pull handle is a great feature! Easy to pull the drain pan when filled. Capacity is five gallons and it is very strong, very rigid. I change my anti freeze coolant every two years. I decided to order a second pan today only for oil changes, GREAT ITEM!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr University of Florida

customer_reviews.title: Good reasonable quality pan
customer_reviews.text: Good size pan and fairly sturdy. The bottom is soft enough that when you wipe it clean it flattens under your hand but no noticeable deformation when I was carrying oil around in it. Worked perfectly and the spout let me pour the oil out cleanly. The handle is great for pulling the full pan out from under the car and hanging the empty pan on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Large drip pan, which is working great for me! I've been able to wipe it clean after tipping it upside down into a plastic container for hours. I like the handle too, it definitely comes in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Blessed Mother

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Big target
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Big target. Fold down handle proved useful to slide under vehicle. Easy pour spout. Prefer this straight spout to those curving down. Stopper works well. I put filter on ledge to drain. Pan cleans easily. With minimum care, should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: I.B. Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Best drain pan you'll ever own
customer_reviews.text: Finally a drain pan big enough for an oil change on a Tundra (8 quarts). I know it is hard to get excited over a drain pan, but this pan is AWESOME!!!! Very sturdy, has a lip around it that prevents splashes, pours nicely and even has a handle to pull it from under your vehicle.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and large enough to catch fluids and oils while ...

Also, the height was just right for my 8th gen. Civic and I was able to slide it under the car without having to lift the vehicle.
